camel.source.path.httpURI.name: camel.source.path.httpURI
camel.source.path.httpURI.description: The url of the HTTP endpoint to use.

camel.source.endpoint.useStreaming.name: camel.source.endpoint.useStreaming
camel.source.endpoint.useStreaming.description: For HTTP endpoint: if true, text and binary messages will be wrapped as java.io.InputStream before they are passed to an Exchange; otherwise they will be passed as byte. For WebSocket endpoint: if true, text and binary messages will be wrapped as java.io.Reader and java.io.InputStream respectively before they are passed to an Exchange; otherwise they will be passed as String and byte respectively.

camel.source.endpoint.accessLog.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessLog
camel.source.endpoint.accessLog.description: Whether or not the consumer should write access log

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.httpMethodRestrict.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpMethodRestrict
camel.source.endpoint.httpMethodRestrict.description: Used to only allow consuming if the HttpMethod matches, such as GET/POST/PUT etc. Multiple methods can be specified separated by comma.

camel.source.endpoint.matchOnUriPrefix.name: camel.source.endpoint.matchOnUriPrefix
camel.source.endpoint.matchOnUriPrefix.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.

camel.source.endpoint.muteException.name: camel.source.endpoint.muteException
camel.source.endpoint.muteException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side the response's body won't contain the exception's stack trace.

camel.source.endpoint.optionsEnabled.name: camel.source.endpoint.optionsEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.optionsEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP OPTIONS for this Servlet consumer. By default OPTIONS is turned off.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.handlers.name: camel.source.endpoint.handlers
camel.source.endpoint.handlers.description: Specifies a comma-delimited set of io.undertow.server.HttpHandler instances to lookup in your Registry. These handlers are added to the Undertow handler chain (for example, to add security). Important: You can not use different handlers with different Undertow endpoints using the same port number. The handlers is associated to the port number. If you need different handlers, then use different port numbers.

camel.source.endpoint.accessLogReceiver.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessLogReceiver
camel.source.endpoint.accessLogReceiver.description: Which Undertow AccessLogReceiver should be used Will use JBossLoggingAccessLogReceiver if not specified

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.undertowHttpBindin.name: camel.source.endpoint.undertowHttpBinding
camel.source.endpoint.undertowHttpBindin.description: To use a custom UndertowHttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and undertow.

camel.source.endpoint.allowedRoles.name: camel.source.endpoint.allowedRoles
camel.source.endpoint.allowedRoles.description: Configuration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Comma separated list of allowed roles.

camel.source.endpoint.securityConfigurat.name: camel.source.endpoint.securityConfiguration
camel.source.endpoint.securityConfigurat.description: OConfiguration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Security configuration object for use from UndertowSecurityProvider. Configuration is UndertowSecurityProvider specific. Each provider decides whether accepts configuration.

camel.source.endpoint.securityProvider.name: camel.source.endpoint.securityProvider
camel.source.endpoint.securityProvider.description: Security provider allows plug in the provider, which will be used to secure requests. SPI approach could be used too (endpoint then finds security provider using SPI).

camel.source.endpoint.fireWebSocketChann.name: camel.source.endpoint.fireWebSocketChannelEvents
camel.source.endpoint.fireWebSocketChann.description: if true, the consumer will post notifications to the route when a new WebSocket peer connects, disconnects, etc. See UndertowConstants.EVENT_TYPE and EventType.

camel.component.undertow.bridgeErrorHand.name: camel.component.undertow.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.undertow.bridgeErrorHand.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.undertow.muteException.name: camel.component.undertow.muteException
camel.component.undertow.muteException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side the response's body won't contain the exception's stack trace.

camel.component.undertow.basicPropertyBi.name: camel.component.undertow.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.undertow.basicPropertyBi.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.undertow.hostOptions.name: camel.component.undertow.hostOptions
camel.component.undertow.hostOptions.description: To configure common options, such as thread pools

camel.component.undertow.undertowHttpBin.name: camel.component.undertow.undertowHttpBinding
camel.component.undertow.undertowHttpBin.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

camel.component.undertow.allowedRoles.name: camel.component.undertow.allowedRoles
camel.component.undertow.allowedRoles.description: Configuration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Comma separated list of allowed roles.

camel.component.undertow.securityConfigu.name: camel.component.undertow.securityConfiguration
camel.component.undertow.securityConfigu.description: Configuration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Security configuration object for use from UndertowSecurityProvider. Configuration is UndertowSecurityProvider specific. Each provider decides, whether it accepts configuration.

camel.component.undertow.securityProvide.name: camel.component.undertow.securityProvider
camel.component.undertow.securityProvide.description: Security provider allows plug in the provider, which will be used to secure requests. SPI approach could be used too (component then finds security provider using SPI).

camel.component.undertow.useGlobalSslCon.name: camel.component.undertow.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.undertow.useGlobalSslCon.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
